snippet: The mother and father of Tyler Clementi said the written statement of Dharun Ravi, who began a jail sentence in the case, was a “public relations piece” and lacked sincerity.
abstract: Parents of Rutgers University student Tyler Clementi, who killed himself after roommate Dharun Ravi used a webcam to spy on his intimate encounter with another man, dismiss Ravi's apology, calling it insincere, and too little, too late; Joseph and Jane Clementi also say judge's decision not to impose jail time for bias crime charges is a missed opportunity to highlight the seriousness of such crimes.
lead_paragraph: The mother and father of Tyler Clementi said the written statement of Dharun Ravi, who began a jail sentence in the case, was a “public relations piece” and lacked sincerity.

headline.seo: Parents of Rutgers Spying Victim Reject Roommate’s Apology
headline.main: Parents of Rutgers Spying Victim Reject Roommate’s Apology
headline.print_headline: Parents Spurn Apology Over Rutgers Spying
